content:
XsltFunctions Class

In this Article

XSLT and XPath functions.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsable(System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsableState.Never)]
public static class XsltFunctions

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • XsltFunctions

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,

Methods summary

BaseUri(XPathNavigator)

Returns the value of the base URI of the node of the node passed in by the navigator parameter. Implements baseUri XPath function according to the W3C specification.
Contains(String,String)

Implements contains XPath function according to the W3C specification.
EXslObjectType(IList<XPathItem>)

Implements exsl:object-type.
Lang(String,XPathNavigator)

Implements the lang function according to the W3C XPath specification.
MSFormatDateTime(String,String,String,Boolean)

Implements the ms:format-date and ms-format-timeMicrosoft XPath extension functions.
MSLocalName(String)

Implements the ms:local-nameMicrosoft XPath extension function.
MSNamespaceUri(String,XPathNavigator)

Implements the ms:namespace-uriMicrosoft XPath extension function.
MSNumber(IList<XPathItem>)

Implements ms:numberMicrosoft XPath extension function.
MSStringCompare(String,String,String,String)

Implements ms:string-compareMicrosoft XPath extension function.
MSUtc(String)

Implements the ms:utcMicrosoft XPath extension function.
NormalizeSpace(String)

Removes leading and trailing spaces from the specified string and returns the result. Implements normalize-space function from the W3C XPath standard.
OuterXml(XPathNavigator)

Gets the markup representing the opening and closing tags of the node and all child nodes of the node identified by the XPathNavigator argument.
Round(Double)

Rounds value by using XPath rounding rules. Rounds towards positive infinity. Values between -0.5 and -0.0 are rounded to -0.0 (negative zero).
StartsWith(String,String)

Implements starts-with XPath function according to the W3C specification.
Substring(String,Double)

Implements substring XPath function according to the W3C specification.
Substring(String,Double,Double)

Implements substring XPath function according to the W3C specification.
SubstringAfter(String,String)

Implements substring-after XPath function according to the W3C specification.
SubstringBefore(String,String)

Implements substring-before XPath function according to the W3C specification.
SystemProperty(XmlQualifiedName)

Implements system-property XSLT function according to the W3C specification.
Translate(String,String,String)

Implements translate XPath function according to the W3C specification.

Methods

  • BaseUri(XPathNavigator)

    Returns the value of the base URI of the node of the node passed in by the navigator parameter. Implements baseUri XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static string BaseUri (System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator navigator);

    Parameters

    • navigator
      XPathNavigator

      The XPathNavigator instance that contains the node to be identified by URI.

    Returns

    • String

      The base URI as String.

  • Contains(String,String)

    Implements contains XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static bool Contains (string s1, string s2);

    Parameters

    • s1
      String

      The string in which to locate s2.

    • s2
      String

      The string to locate in s1.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the first argument string contains the second argument string; otherwise, false.

  • EXslObjectType(IList<XPathItem>)

    Implements exsl:object-type.

    public static string EXslObjectType (System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> value);

    Parameters

    • value
      IList<XPathItem>

      The XPathItem of which to determine type.

    Returns

    • String

      Object type as String.

  • Lang(String,XPathNavigator)

    Implements the lang function according to the W3C XPath specification.

    public static bool Lang (string value, System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator context);

    Parameters

    • value
      String

      The specified string.

    • context
      XPathNavigator

      XPathNavigator object that contains context.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      Boolean.

  • MSFormatDateTime(String,String,String,Boolean)

    Implements the ms:format-date and ms-format-timeMicrosoft XPath extension functions.

    public static string MSFormatDateTime (string dateTime, string format, string lang, bool isDate);

    Parameters

    • dateTime
      String

      String that contains date/time data.

    • format
      String

      String that contains format.

    • lang
      String

      String that contains language.

    • isDate
      Boolean

      Boolean value that indicates whether date/time contains a date.

    Returns

    • String

      String that contains formatted date and time.

  • MSLocalName(String)

    Implements the ms:local-nameMicrosoft XPath extension function.

    public static string MSLocalName (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name.

    Returns

    • String

      Name as String.

  • MSNamespaceUri(String,XPathNavigator)

    Implements the ms:namespace-uriMicrosoft XPath extension function.

    public static string MSNamespaceUri (string name, System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator currentNode);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name.

    • currentNode
      XPathNavigator

      The XPathNavigator instance.

    Returns

    • String

      Namespace URI as String.

  • MSNumber(IList<XPathItem>)

    Implements ms:numberMicrosoft XPath extension function.

    public static double MSNumber (System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> value);

    Parameters

    • value
      IList<XPathItem>

      stem.Collections.Generic.List`1 of XPathItem.

    Returns

    • Double

      Double.

  • MSStringCompare(String,String,String,String)

    Implements ms:string-compareMicrosoft XPath extension function.

    public static double MSStringCompare (string s1, string s2, string lang, string options);

    Parameters

    • s1
      String

      The first string to compare.

    • s2
      String

      The second string to compare.

    • lang
      String

      The language. Optional

    • options
      String

      Specifies whether the comparison is case-sensitive.

    Returns

    • Double

      If s1 < s2 the method returns -1. If s1 == s2 the method returns 0. If s1 > s2 the method returns 1.

  • MSUtc(String)

    Implements the ms:utcMicrosoft XPath extension function.

    public static string MSUtc (string dateTime);

    Parameters

    • dateTime
      String

      String that contains date/time data.

    Returns

    • String

      A string that contains date/time information. If a string cannot be interpreted as a valid XSD date/time-related format, it returns an empty string.

    Remarks

    Converts date/time-related values into Coordinated Universal Time and into a fixed (normalized) representation that can be sorted and compared lexicographically.

  • NormalizeSpace(String)

    Removes leading and trailing spaces from the specified string and returns the result. Implements normalize-space function from the W3C XPath standard.

    public static string NormalizeSpace (string value);

    Parameters

    • value
      String

      The specified string.

    Returns

    • String

      A normalized string.

  • OuterXml(XPathNavigator)

    Gets the markup representing the opening and closing tags of the node and all child nodes of the node identified by the XPathNavigator argument.

    public static string OuterXml (System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator navigator);

    Parameters

    • navigator
      XPathNavigator

      XPathNavigator that identifies the node.

    Returns

    • String

      A string that contains the opening and closing tags of the node and all child nodes of the node that is identified by the navigator parameter.

  • Round(Double)

    Rounds value by using XPath rounding rules. Rounds towards positive infinity. Values between -0.5 and -0.0 are rounded to -0.0 (negative zero).

    public static double Round (double value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Double

      Double number to round.

    Returns

    • Double

      The rounded number as Double.

  • StartsWith(String,String)

    Implements starts-with XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static bool StartsWith (string s1, string s2);

    Parameters

    • s1
      String

      A string, the beginning of which is compared to s2.

    • s2
      String

      The string to compare to the beginning of s1.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the first argument string starts with the second argument string; otherwise, false.

  • Substring(String,Double)

    Implements substring XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static string Substring (string value, double startIndex);

    Parameters

    • value
      String

      The string from which to retrieve the substring.

    • startIndex
      Double

      The starting character position of a substring in s.

    Returns

    • String

      The substring of the first argument starting at the position specified in the second argument

  • Substring(String,Double,Double)

    Implements substring XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static string Substring (string value, double startIndex, double length);

    Parameters

    • value
      String

      The string from which to retrieve the substring.

    • startIndex
      Double

      The starting character position of a substring in s.

    • length
      Double

      The number of characters in the substring.

    Returns

    • String

      The substring of the first argument, starting at the position specified in the second argument, with the length specified in the third argument.

  • SubstringAfter(String,String)

    Implements substring-after XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static string SubstringAfter (string s1, string s2);

    Parameters

    • s1
      String

      The string in which to locate s2.

    • s2
      String

      The string to locate in s1.

    Returns

    • String

      The characters in s1 that occur after s2, or the empty string if s1 does not contain s2.

    Remarks

    Locates a substring (s2) within a string (s1), and returns the characters in s1 that occur after s2.

  • SubstringBefore(String,String)

    Implements substring-before XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static string SubstringBefore (string s1, string s2);

    Parameters

    • s1
      String

      The string in which to locate s2.

    • s2
      String

      The string to locate in s1.

    Returns

    • String

      The characters in s1 that occur before s2, or the empty string if s1 does not contain s2.

    Remarks

    Locates a substring (s2) within a string (s1), and returns the characters in s1 that occur before s2.

  • SystemProperty(XmlQualifiedName)

    Implements system-property XSLT function according to the W3C specification.

    public static System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem SystemProperty (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name);

    Parameters

    • name
      XmlQualifiedName

      The name of the system property.

    Returns

    • XPathItem

      The value of the system property specified by the name.

  • Translate(String,String,String)

    Implements translate XPath function according to the W3C specification.

    public static string Translate (string arg, string mapString, string transString);

    Parameters

    • arg
      String

      The original string.

    • mapString
      String

      The substring in arg that should be replaced with transString.

    • transString
      String

      The string to replace mapString with.

    Returns

    • String

      The translated value as String.

    Remarks

    Converts a string (arg) by replacing the characters in a substring (mapString) with the characters in another string (tranString).
